xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class SiteLocalCommunicationAddress

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.TCPCommunicationAddress
      • xyz.acygn.mokapot.SiteLocalCommunicationAddress
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommunicationAddress, Copiable

    public class SiteLocalCommunicationAddress
extends TCPCommunicationAddress
    A TCPCommunicationAddress designed for situations in which the communication takes place over a site-local network, using site-local addresses.

    The IP address given will be checked to see that it's in the site-local range.

    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SiteLocalCommunicationAddress(InetAddress inetAddress, int port)
      Creates a TCP communication address from a site-local IP address and a port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SiteLocalCommunicationAddress

        public SiteLocalCommunicationAddress(InetAddress inetAddress,
                                     int port)
        Creates a TCP communication address from a site-local IP address and a port.
        Parameters:
        inetAddress - A site-local IP address which is used to communicate with the VM described by this communication address.
        port - The port on which to communicate.

        The TCP port via which connections via this address are made.

      • compatibleWithAddress

        public boolean compatibleWithAddress(CommunicationAddress address)
        Checks whether the given address could sensibly exist in the same distributed computation as this address. This is a check to ensure that the addresses exist on the same site-local network.
        Parameters:
        address - The address to check.
        Returns:
        Whether address is a SiteLocalCommunicationAddress on the same network as this address.
